citation.title: PATTERNS OF ANTITHROMBOTIC USE IN RELATION TO THE CHA2DS2-VASC AND THE CHADS2-65 STROKE RISK SCORE IN CONTEMPORARY PRACTICE: INSIGHTS FROM A PROSPECTIVE CANADIAN AF REGISTRY

news.title: Canadian Cardiovascular Society Sets New Guidelines for Management of Lipid Metabolism Disorders that Affect Cholesterol and Cause Atherosclerosis
news.summary: Printer friendly versionShare 11 October 2016 Elsevier New evidence-based guidance emphasizes importance of shared decision-making between physician and patient, reports the Canadian Journal of Cardiology.

news.title: Canadian Cardiovascular Society sets new guidelines for management of lipid metabolism disorders that affect cholesterol and cause atherosclerosis
news.summary: Philadelphia, PA, October 11, 2016 - The Canadian Cardiovascular Society (CCS) has published an important update to its guidelines for the management of dyslipidemia - lipid metabolism disorders - that can cause cardiovascular disease.

news.title: CCS sets new guidelines for management of lipid metabolism disorders that affect cholesterol and cause atherosclerosis
news.summary: ABI, ankle-brachial index; ACR, albumin:creatinine ratio; eGFR, estimated glomerular filtration rate; LDL-C, low-density lipoprotein cholesterol; TIA, transient ischemic attack.
